summary: Email from Michael Miller, a member of Jeffrey Epstein's legal team, to Dr. Graham at the NYC Office of Chief Medical Examiner, confirming that Dr. Michael Baden has been arranged to observe Jeffrey Epstein's autopsy scheduled for the following day (August 12, 2019).

persons.name: Michael Miller
persons.role: Legal team member for Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identifies himself as part of Jeffrey Epstein's legal team and coordinates the autopsy observation arrangement with the medical examiner's office.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the autopsy being discussed; the email is from his legal team regarding the procedure.

persons.name: Michael Baden
persons.context: Arranged by Epstein's legal team to observe the autopsy on their behalf.

persons.name: Graham
persons.context: Recipient of the email at the NYC Office of Chief Medical Examiner (OCME), responsible for conducting the autopsy.

persons.name: Marty Weinberg
persons.context: Cc'd on the email; likely another legal team member or associate given the context.

connections.description: Miller identifies himself as part of Epstein's legal team, indicating a professional legal representation relationship.
Miller arranged for Baden to observe the autopsy on behalf of Epstein's legal team.
Baden was engaged by Epstein's legal team to observe the autopsy, serving as their representative during the procedure.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Autopsy
events.description: The autopsy of Jeffrey Epstein is scheduled to be performed, with Michael Baden arranged to observe on behalf of Epstein's legal team.

locations: NYC Office of Chief Medical Examiner (OCME)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's legal team proactively arranged for an independent observer, Dr. Michael Baden, to be present at his autopsy.
The autopsy was scheduled for August 12, 2019, the day after this email was sent.
The email demonstrates the legal team's active involvement in the death investigation process immediately following Epstein's death.
